summary: This bill, the Big Bend National Park Boundary Adjustment Act, proposes to adjust the boundary of Big Bend National Park in Texas. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to acquire approximately 6,100 acres of land or interests in land through donation or exchange. Upon acquisition, the Secretary is required to revise the park's boundary accordingly and administer the new land as part of the park. Importantly, the bill explicitly prohibits the use of eminent domain or condemnation for land acquisition.
